sentences: Return to Transcripts main pageCROSSFIREShould U.S. Trust Russia on Syria?Aired September 10, 2013 - 18:28 ETTHIS IS A RUSH TRANSCRIPT.
label: true_

sentences: THIS COPY MAY NOT BE IN ITS FINAL FORM AND MAY BE UPDATED.ANNOUNCER: Tonight on CROSSFIRE, as President Obama prepares to address the nation, he hits the pause button on attacking Syria.
label: true_

sentences: Should he follow Russia's lead or keep threatening a military strike?JOHN KERRY, SECRETARY OF STATE: Nothing focuses the mind like the prospect of a hanging.ANNOUNCER: On the left, Van Jones.
label: true_

sentences: On the right, S.E.
label: true_

sentences: In the CROSSFIRE, Joe Lieberman, who supports the strike on Syria, and Rick Santorum, who's opposed.
label: true_

sentences: Is Russia's diplomacy real?
label: true_

sentences: Or should the U.S. strike Assad now?
label: true_

sentences: Tonight on CROSSFIRE.VAN JONES, CO-HOST: Welcome to CROSSFIRE.
label: true_

sentences: CUPP, CO-HOST: I'm S.E.
label: true_

sentences: Cupp on the right.Tonight, the world is giddy at the prospect of getting out of a U.S. military strike on Syria.
label: true_

sentences: It's all thanks to Russia's offer of a diplomatic solution, even though it's a phony one.
label: true_

sentences: Nevertheless, the president's team is more than happy to take credit for it.
label: true_

sentences: NANCY PELOSI (D-CA), MINORITY LEADER: This is a victory for President Obama, if it is real.
label: true_

sentences: Look, everyone wants to parachute out of this conflict.
label: true_

sentences: But the Russians have offered us not a parachute but a knapsack.
label: true_

sentences: A knapsack that will never open.
label: true_

sentences: This is nothing more than a delay tactic.JONES: Well, I disagree.
label: true_

sentences: First of all, I think the world is rightfully happy that we are off the path to war, possibly.
label: true_

sentences: The diplomatic option is a good thing.
label: true_

sentences: And frankly, everybody is giving John Kerry a hard time.
label: true_

sentences: I would rather for us to blunder on the path to peace than to stumble onto the path of war.CUPP: If this were proposal -- if this proposal were real and offered up by legitimate, good actors, I would be happy to consider it.JONES: Well, welcome to the real world, where you don't get the chance to pick who offers you a solution to this thing.Look, we've got two former presidential candidates and two former senators -- both the same person -- tonight on CROSSFIRE to help us with this thing.RICK SANTORUM (R), FORMER PENNSYLVANIA SENATOR: Two friends, I might add.

sentences: And two friends.JONES: And two friends.

label: true_

sentences: Now he has the power to do something, and he went to Congress.

sentences: So it's clear he didn't want to do this.JONES: You're on team Obama now.SANTORUM: I'm on team "let's not broaden this war and put a much more complicated diplomatic situation and military situation in the hands of someone who's proved incapable of handling the situation.
label: true_

sentences: "JONES: We'll argue about that later.CUPP: Senator Lieberman, why after two years and 100,000 people dead, two chemical attacks, two million refugees, why is pausing yet again to dither on this conflict the smart or moral decision?JOE LIEBERMAN (I), FORMER CONNECTICUT SENATOR: Well, I wish we were not pausing.
label: true_

sentences: I mean, I think President Obama made the right moral decision when he drew the red line --CUPP: Right.LIEBERMAN: -- and then when he said, after we had proof that chemical weapons were used to kill almost 1,500 innocents, including 426 children by Assad in Syria, that he was going to take military action.I was really surprised and disappointed when he decided to toss it to Congress.

label: true_

sentences: He had the legal authority to do it himself.
label: true_

sentences: Is that what you're saying?LIEBERMAN: No, I'm saying that it's hard to take the proposal by Russia seriously, but it's important enough that we've got to challenge them to be serious about it and see if Syria really will, with international supervision and penalties, get rid of all their chemical weapons.
